segment.source: DISM Global Options for Command-Line Syntax
segment.target: DISM Global Options for Command-Line Syntax

segment.source: DISM Global Options for Command-Line Syntax
segment.target: DISM Global Options for Command-Line Syntax

segment.source: DISM Global Options for Command-Line Syntax
segment.target: DISM Global Options for Command-Line Syntax

segment.source: Global options can be added to most of the servicing and imaging options in the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool.
segment.target: Global options can be added to most of the servicing and imaging options in the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool.

segment.source: These options can be used to access the command-line help, specify the location of files to use, and control logging.
segment.target: These options can be used to access the command-line help, specify the location of files to use, and control logging.

segment.source: Basic Syntax for Servicing Commands
segment.target: Basic Syntax for Servicing Commands

segment.source: After you have mounted or applied a Windows® image so that it is available offline as a flat file structure, you can specify any DISM global options, the servicing option that will update your image, and the location of the offline image.
segment.target: After you have mounted or applied a Windows® image so that it is available offline as a flat file structure, you can specify any DISM global options, the servicing option that will update your image, and the location of the offline image.

segment.source: You can use only one servicing option per command line.
segment.target: You can use only one servicing option per command line.

segment.source: If you are servicing a running computer, you can use the /Online option instead of specifying the location of the offline Windows image.
segment.target: If you are servicing a running computer, you can use the /Online option instead of specifying the location of the offline Windows image.

segment.source: The commands and options that are available for servicing an image depend on which Windows operating system you are servicing.
segment.target: The commands and options that are available for servicing an image depend on which Windows operating system you are servicing.

segment.source: They also depend on whether the image is offline or a running operating system.
segment.target: They also depend on whether the image is offline or a running operating system.

segment.source: All commands work on an offline Windows image.
segment.target: All commands work on an offline Windows image.

segment.source: Subsets of the commands are available for servicing a running operating system.
segment.target: Subsets of the commands are available for servicing a running operating system.

segment.source: The base syntax for DISM servicing commands is:
segment.target: The base syntax for DISM servicing commands is:

segment.source: DISM.exe {/Image:pathtoimage/Online} dismglobaloptions {servicingoption} servicingargument
segment.target: DISM.exe {/Image:pathtoimage/Online} dismglobaloptions {servicingoption} servicingargument

segment.source: For more information about servicing commands, see Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information about servicing commands, see Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Basic Syntax for Imaging Commands
segment.target: Basic Syntax for Imaging Commands

segment.source: Many of the global options are also available for imaging commands.
segment.target: Many of the global options are also available for imaging commands.

segment.source: The base syntax for DISM imaging commands is:
segment.target: The base syntax for DISM imaging commands is:

segment.source:
DISM.exe
dismglobaloptions {servicingoption} servicingargument
segment.target:
DISM.exe
dismglobaloptions {servicingoption} servicingargument

segment.source: For more information about using DISM for image management, such as applying or mounting an image, see DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information about using DISM for image management, such as applying or mounting an image, see DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Global Options for Servicing and Imaging Commands
segment.target: Global Options for Servicing and Imaging Commands

segment.source: The following DISM global options are available for an offline image.
segment.target: The following DISM global options are available for an offline image.

segment.source:
DISM.exe /image:
pathtoofflineimagedirectory
/WinDir:
pathto%WINDIR%
/LogPath:
pathtologfile.log
/LogLevel: n/SysDriveDir:pathtobootMgrfile/Quiet/NoRestart/ScratchDir:pathtoscratchdirectory/English/Format:outputformat
segment.target:
DISM.exe /image:
pathtoofflineimagedirectory
/WinDir:
pathto%WINDIR%
/LogPath:
pathtologfile.log
/LogLevel: n/SysDriveDir:pathtobootMgrfile/Quiet/NoRestart/ScratchDir:pathtoscratchdirectory/English/Format:outputformat

segment.source: The following DISM global options are available for a running operating system.
segment.target: The following DISM global options are available for a running operating system.

segment.source: The following table provides a description of how each DISM global option can be used.
segment.target: The following table provides a description of how each DISM global option can be used.

segment.source: These options are not case sensitive.
segment.target: These options are not case sensitive.

segment.source: Global option
segment.target: Global option

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /Get-Help
segment.target: /Get-Help

segment.source: Displays information about available DISM command-line options and arguments.
segment.target: Displays information about available DISM command-line options and arguments.

segment.source: Use the /?
segment.target: Use the /?

segment.source: or /Get-Help option without specifying an image file to get help on image management commands such as /Mount-Image.
segment.target: or /Get-Help option without specifying an image file to get help on image management commands such as /Mount-Image.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /?
segment.target: Dism /?

segment.source: Specify an image file with the /Image:path_to_an_image option or use the /Online option to get help on the servicing command in the image, such as /Get-Packages.
segment.target: Specify an image file with the /Image:path_to_an_image option or use the /Online option to get help on the servicing command in the image, such as /Get-Packages.

segment.source: The options that are available for servicing an image depend on the servicing technology that is available in your image.
segment.target: The options that are available for servicing an image depend on the servicing technology that is available in your image.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /?
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /?

segment.source: Dism /online /?
segment.target: Dism /online /?

segment.source: You can display additional Help by specifying a command-line option.
segment.target: You can display additional Help by specifying a command-line option.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /Add-Driver /?
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /Add-Driver /?

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /Add-Package /?
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /Add-Package /?

segment.source: Dism /online /Get-Drivers /?
segment.target: Dism /online /Get-Drivers /?

segment.source: /LogPath:path to log file.log
segment.target: /LogPath:path to log file.log

segment.source: Specifies the full path and file name to log to.
segment.target: Specifies the full path and file name to log to.

segment.source: If not set, the default is: %WINDIR%\Logs\Dism\dism.log
segment.target: If not set, the default is: %WINDIR%\Logs\Dism\dism.log

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: In Windows PE, the default directory is the RAMDISK scratch space which can be as low as 32 MB.
segment.target: In Windows PE, the default directory is the RAMDISK scratch space which can be as low as 32 MB.

segment.source: The log file will automatically be archived.
segment.target: The log file will automatically be archived.

segment.source: The archived log file will be saved with .bak appended to the file name and a new log file will be generated.
segment.target: The archived log file will be saved with .bak appended to the file name and a new log file will be generated.

segment.source: Each time the log file is archived the .bak file will be overwritten.
segment.target: Each time the log file is archived the .bak file will be overwritten.

segment.source: When using a network share that is not joined to a domain, use the net use command together with domain credentials to set access permissions before you set the log path for the DISM log.
segment.target: When using a network share that is not joined to a domain, use the net use command together with domain credentials to set access permissions before you set the log path for the DISM log.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /LogPath:AddPackage.log /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /LogPath:AddPackage.log /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab

segment.source: /LogLevel:n
segment.target: /LogLevel:n

segment.source: Specifies the maximum output level shown in the logs.
segment.target: Specifies the maximum output level shown in the logs.

segment.source: The default log level is 3.
segment.target: The default log level is 3.

segment.source: The accepted values are as follows:
segment.target: The accepted values are as follows:

segment.source: 1 = Errors only
segment.target: 1 = Errors only

segment.source: 2 = Errors and warnings
segment.target: 2 = Errors and warnings

segment.source: 3 = Errors, warnings, and informational
segment.target: 3 = Errors, warnings, and informational

segment.source: 4 = All of the information listed previously, plus debug output
segment.target: 4 = All of the information listed previously, plus debug output

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /LogPath:AddPackage.log /LogLevel:1 /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /LogPath:AddPackage.log /LogLevel:1 /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab

segment.source: /Image:path_to_offline_image_directory
segment.target: /Image:path_to_offline_image_directory

segment.source: This is the full path to the root directory of the offline Windows image that you will service.
segment.target: This is the full path to the root directory of the offline Windows image that you will service.

segment.source: If the directory named Windows is not a subdirectory of the root directory, /WinDir must be specified.
segment.target: If the directory named Windows is not a subdirectory of the root directory, /WinDir must be specified.

segment.source: This option cannot be used with /Online.
segment.target: This option cannot be used with /Online.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /LogPath:AddPackage.log /LogLevel:1 /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /LogPath:AddPackage.log /LogLevel:1 /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab

segment.source: /WinDir:path_to_%WINDIR%
segment.target: /WinDir:path_to_%WINDIR%

segment.source: Used with the /Image option to specify the path to the Windows directory relative to the image path.
segment.target: Used with the /Image option to specify the path to the Windows directory relative to the image path.

segment.source: This cannot be the full path to the Windows directory; it should be a relative path.
segment.target: This cannot be the full path to the Windows directory; it should be a relative path.

segment.source: If not specified, the default is the Windows directory in the root of the offline image directory.
segment.target: If not specified, the default is the Windows directory in the root of the offline image directory.

segment.source: This option cannot be used with the /Online option.
segment.target: This option cannot be used with the /Online option.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /WinDir:WinNT /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /WinDir:WinNT /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab

segment.source: /Online
segment.target: /Online

segment.source: Specifies that the action is to be taken on the operating system that is currently running.
segment.target: Specifies that the action is to be taken on the operating system that is currently running.

segment.source: This option cannot be used with the /Image or the /WinDir option.
segment.target: This option cannot be used with the /Image or the /WinDir option.

segment.source: When /Online is used the Windows directory for the online image is automatically detected.
segment.target: When /Online is used the Windows directory for the online image is automatically detected.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /online /Get-Packages
segment.target: Dism /online /Get-Packages

segment.source: /SysDriveDir:path_to_sysdrive_directory
segment.target: /SysDriveDir:path_to_sysdrive_directory

segment.source: Use /SysDriveDir to service an installed Windows image from a Windows PE environment.
segment.target: Use /SysDriveDir to service an installed Windows image from a Windows PE environment.

segment.source: The /SysDriveDir option specifies the path to the location of the BootMgr files.
segment.target: The /SysDriveDir option specifies the path to the location of the BootMgr files.

segment.source: This is necessary only when the BootMgr files are located on a partition other than the one that you are running the command from.
segment.target: This is necessary only when the BootMgr files are located on a partition other than the one that you are running the command from.

segment.source: For example, at a Windows PE command prompt, type:
segment.target: For example, at a Windows PE command prompt, type:

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\Windows /SysDriveDir:C:\
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\Windows /SysDriveDir:C:\

segment.source: /Quiet
segment.target: /Quiet

segment.source: Turns off information and progress output to the console.
segment.target: Turns off information and progress output to the console.

segment.source: Only error messages will be displayed.
segment.target: Only error messages will be displayed.

segment.source: To run in quiet mode, this option must be set every time that the command-line utility is run.
segment.target: To run in quiet mode, this option must be set every time that the command-line utility is run.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Do not use the /Quiet option with /Get commands.
segment.target: Do not use the /Quiet option with /Get commands.

segment.source: No information will be displayed.
segment.target: No information will be displayed.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab /quiet
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab /quiet

segment.source: /NoRestart
segment.target: /NoRestart

segment.source: Suppresses reboot.
segment.target: Suppresses reboot.

segment.source: If a reboot is not required, this command does nothing.
segment.target: If a reboot is not required, this command does nothing.

segment.source: This option will keep the application from prompting for a restart (or keep it from restarting automatically if the /Quiet option is used).
segment.target: This option will keep the application from prompting for a restart (or keep it from restarting automatically if the /Quiet option is used).

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /online /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab /NoRestart /quiet
segment.target: Dism /online /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab /NoRestart /quiet

segment.source: /ScratchDir:path_to_scratchdirectory
segment.target: /ScratchDir:path_to_scratchdirectory

segment.source: Specifies a temporary directory that will be used when extracting files for temporary use during servicing.
segment.target: Specifies a temporary directory that will be used when extracting files for temporary use during servicing.

segment.source: The directory must exist locally.
segment.target: The directory must exist locally.

segment.source: If not specified, the \Windows\%Temp% directory will be used, with a subdirectory name of randomly generated hexadecimal value for each run of DISM.
segment.target: If not specified, the \Windows\%Temp% directory will be used, with a subdirectory name of randomly generated hexadecimal value for each run of DISM.

segment.source: Items in the scratch directory are deleted after each operation.
segment.target: Items in the scratch directory are deleted after each operation.

segment.source: You should not use a network share location as a scratch directory to expand a package (.cab or .msu file) for installation.
segment.target: You should not use a network share location as a scratch directory to expand a package (.cab or .msu file) for installation.

segment.source: The directory used for extracting files for temporary usage during servicing should be a local directory.
segment.target: The directory used for extracting files for temporary usage during servicing should be a local directory.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /ScratchDir:C:\Scratch /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /ScratchDir:C:\Scratch /Add-Package /PackagePath:C:\packages\package.cab

segment.source: /English
segment.target: /English

segment.source: Displays command-line output in English.
segment.target: Displays command-line output in English.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Some resources cannot be displayed in English.
segment.target: Some resources cannot be displayed in English.

segment.source: This option is not supported when you use the DISM /?
segment.target: This option is not supported when you use the DISM /?

segment.source: command.
segment.target: command.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /Get-ImageInfo /ImageFile:C:\test\offline\install.wim /index:1 /English
segment.target: Dism /Get-ImageInfo /ImageFile:C:\test\offline\install.wim /index:1 /English

segment.source: /Format:{Table | List}
segment.target: /Format:{Table | List}

segment.source: Specifies the report output format.
segment.target: Specifies the report output format.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /Image:C:\test\offline /Get-Apps /Format:table
segment.target: Dism /Image:C:\test\offline /Get-Apps /Format:table
